oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pre-Columbian human head figurine
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pre-Columbian solid, but flat backed ceramic figure. Evidence of breasts just abouve the break off on the lower part of the figure. Large ear adornments and depicted long hair along with the evidence of breasts suggest the figure represents an upper class woman. The eyes are narrowed and the nose is either pierced with a large piece of jewelry or is representitive of some mild anthropomorphism as the nostrils are flaring above two large protrusions. The figure also has a neck adornment or collar.

Overall good condition other than wear. Breakage near the bottom of the figure suggests that it may have been larger at one time. Some chipping around the edges. Evidence of worn off, reddish slip or paint.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Antiquities, Prehistoric; Indians of Central America -- Antiquities; Indians of South America -- Antiquities
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: George and Louis Patten collection of Salem Hyde papers and cultural artifacts
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: George and Louise Patten collection of Salem Hyde cultural artifacts
